section.name: Building Maven
section.p: Building Maven is a little different than your typical Java build because Maven uses itself to build itself! Thus, in order to successfully build Maven, a bootstrapping process is required to jumpstart the build. Fortunately, the details of this have been encapsulated in a separate build file called build-bootstrap.xml. This document details the necessary steps to successfully build Maven from source. After completing the process, not only will Maven be built, it will also be installed on your system, which will enable you to build any other Maven-enabled project (i.e. all Turbine projects).

Before you can build Maven, you'll need to make sure you have Ant 1.5 or higher installed on your system. Don't forget to install the optional.jar included with Ant. In addition, you'll also need the JUnit unit testing framework installed. Be sure to install junit.jar in your $ANT_HOME/lib directory. Failure to do so will result in build errors.
You also must have the $MAVEN_HOME env-var set. The Maven installation is encapsulated in the $MAVEN_HOME directory: scripts, Maven's run-time library, plug-ins and the local repository.

subsection.name: Bootstrapping Maven
subsection.p: Before you can begin the process, you'll need to download the source from the maven CVS repository. If you are not familiar with the Jakarta CVS repositories, please see the documentation.

Thats it! Congratulations! You have now built Maven with Maven and installed Maven on your system! What does that mean?

ul.li: The Maven build system has been installed in $MAVEN_HOME.

The Maven JAR has been installed in your local repository, which defaults to $MAVEN_HOME/repository, so that plug-ins that might require Maven can build and it is installed in Maven's run-time directory.
You can now build any Maven-enabled project with ease! Please see the Using Maven document for instructions on how to build Maven-enabled projects.
You can now integrate Maven into your own projects! Please see the Integrate Maven document for instructions on how to do this.
